missing_requirements.requirement: Fix the PERSONAL and PROFESSIONAL mode selector text-link styling so that in the selected/active state (when the label becomes bold), the border/underline correctly spans the full rendered text width exactly as it does on hover, without changing any existing transitions/timings/animations/visual design.
missing_requirements.reason: The CSS shows the underline expanding on hover only (.mode-selector:hover::after { transform: scaleX(1); }), but there is no shown rule that expands the underline in the active/selected state (e.g., via .mode-selector-active::after or a parent active state). Without an active-state transform override, the underline remains scaleX(0) when selected, so the acceptance criteria for active underline spanning the full bold text width is not demonstrably implemented.
